citation.title: Mitochondrial aldehyde dehydrogenase polymorphism in Asian and American Indian populations: detection of new ALDH2 alleles.

comment.text: An aldehyde + NAD(+) + H(2)O = a carboxylate + NADH.
Alcohol metabolism; ethanol degradation; acetate from ethanol: step 2/2.

Genetic variation in ALDH2 is responsible for individual differences in responses to drinking alcohol [MIM:610251]. Allele ALDH2*2 is associated with a very high incidence of acute alcohol intoxication in Orientals and South American Indians, as compared to Caucasians.
Belongs to the aldehyde dehydrogenase family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

feature.description: In allele ALDH2*2; drastic reduction of enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs671.
